image.altText: Students sit with their teacher in a classroom

props.synopsis: The federal government will invest an additional $737 million from 2025 to 2029 in Northern Territory public schools under the agreement, which it says will go to addressing serious educational disadvantage in the territory.

title.children: Federal and NT governments announce $1b package to fully fund NT public schools

image.altText: A police cruiser's lights flashing in the darkness.

props.synopsis: Police have also charged one of the offenders over a robbery that happened hours before the alleged home invasion.

title.children: Four charged over alleged knifepoint robbery of elderly Alice Springs couple

image.altText: People mooning the Ghan.

props.synopsis: Twenty years after baring their bums for the first time, old-time mooners have been joined by many first-timers to welcome passengers of the iconic tourist train The Ghan as it approaches Darwin.

title.children: In a territory tradition, The Ghan is mooned by hundreds of bare bums near Darwin

image.altText: A man in a dark suit stands outside, surrounded by journalists.

props.synopsis: In a statement issued outside the Newcastle Local Court, Brett Button said he was "devastated" by the 2023 crash.

title.children: 'I am devastated': Hunter Valley bus driver 'truly sorry' over crash after wedding that left 10 dead

image.altText: Black and white wedding photo of murder victim Kelly Wilkinson smiling.

props.synopsis: A man who repeatedly stabbed his estranged wife, then set her on fire in her backyard on the Gold Coast almost three years ago, has been jailed for life.

title.children: 'You brutally killed her': Kelly Wilkinson's estranged husband sentenced to life in jail

image.altText: A photo of Santanaya Namatjira with her tongue out.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are calling for information about the whereabouts of a 13-year-old girl who was last seen nearly a week ago walking to a store in Alice Springs.

title.children: Missing Alice Springs girl, 13, last seen walking to the shops

image.altText: A man standing out the front of a Service SA sign.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man who falsely tested positive on a roadside drug screening has been issued a three-month loss of licence, despite official results revealing he was not driving under the influence.

title.children: 'The stress level is absolutely beyond': Man loses licence after false positive drug test

image.altText: A portrait photo of a mother surrounded by her three children. There is a suitcase with them. They look close.

props.synopsis: The Top End mother says rural families are leaving the Northern Territory because of the emotional and financial costs of sending children to boarding school.

title.children: Mum says boarding school is a necessity, but it comes at a huge cost for her remote NT family

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: Meta's move has sparked concerns Australians could see a repeat of previous news bans — here's what the experts say is likely to happen next.

title.children: Meta won't pay for news anymore — here's what experts say about a total ban

image.altText: A police tape blocks off a suburban street. Police can be seen in the background talking.

props.synopsis: A Darwin court has heard a man was allegedly armed with a spear and attempting to throw it at police officers before one of them fired up to six shots during an altercation in 2022, as dramatic bodyworn video of the incident is aired in court.

title.children: Constable 'feared for his life' during confrontation with man allegedly armed with spear, court hears

image.altText: A man in a black hat holds a camera up for a selfie photo

props.synopsis: A pizza delivery driver who was accused of causing the deaths of two teenagers walks free from court as a Perth judge finds the evidence at his trial does not support the allegation he took his hands off the steering wheel.

title.children: Young driver found not guilty of causing deaths of teenage friends after court case thrown out

image.altText: A vertically oriented explosion is visible against a backdrop of ocean and forested mountainside.

props.synopsis: The 18-metre, four-stage solid-fuel rocket exploded seconds after lifting off just after 11:01am, leaving behind a large cloud of smoke, fire, and fragments of the rocket.

title.children: Japanese company Space One's Kairos rocket explodes just seconds after launch

image.altText: A statue of a bull charging sits on a paved city street

props.synopsis: Meanwhile, embattled consultancy firm PwC is making more than 300 roles redundant. In the US, inflation data raises more questions about the timing of future cuts to interest rates in the world's largest economy. Follow on our live markets blog.

title.children: Bendigo Bank predicts no rate cuts until 2025, while some CBA customers still experiencing issues after outage

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Celebrity economist Yanis Varoufakis makes spicy speech about Australia's 'creeping irrelevance'
Rate cuts unlikely until 2025, says Bendigo Bank
Were you impacted by the CommBank outage?

image.altText: A young man.

props.synopsis: After a 17-year search for answers, Bill and Cheryl McCormack are pinning their hopes on advancements in DNA testing and video software in the hunt for their son Shannon's killer.

title.children: Parents of 22-year-old who died after one-punch attack look to new technology to find son's killer

image.altText: Drone vision of a dolphin carcass floating in the ocean in a net.

props.synopsis: A resident who caught vision of the dead animal north of Wollongong on his lunchbreak says he hopes it creates impetus for change.

title.children: Dolphin's 'needless' death off NSW coast reignites calls for shark net removal

image.altText: A man and his smiling wife.

props.synopsis: A Victorian survivor of abuse and sexual violence has spoken out after her former husband was sentenced over the horror she endured at his hands.

title.children: Former White Ribbon ambassador jailed for raping wife

image.altText: A woman laying down face up on a beige couch with yellow woolen cardigan, and hands covering her face.

props.synopsis: Coeliac disease can have significant long-term health impacts but most people living with the condition don't know they have it. There are some simple steps to take if you think you're one of them.

title.children: Most people with coeliac disease don't know they have it. Here are the signs to look out for

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Raymond Shaw says he has spent the past five-and-a-half weeks uncovering and exploring disused mine shafts in a determined effort to find anything that helps locate the Ballarat mum.

title.children: There are countless mineshafts in the area searched for signs of Samantha Murphy. This is what it's like inside them

image.altText: An aerial shot of a large stream of reddish-brown water in an outback landscape.

props.synopsis: Police say they are unable to resume searching for a missing party of seven people caught up in WA's flood-stricken outback due to severe weather.

title.children: Search for WA family enters third day, as severe flooding continues to wreak havoc

image.altText: Rohan Dennis walking outside court

props.synopsis: Former professional cyclist Rohan Dennis has faced court for the first time since being charged with causing the death of his Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins, with prosecutors requesting time to complete a major crash reconstruction.

title.children: Rohan Dennis faces court charged with causing death of Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: More than one in four residential properties purchased in New South Wales, Victoria and Queensland last year were paid for entirely with cash by older Australians, highlighting the growing disparity in the property market.

title.children: More Australians are buying properties in cash. It risks making the housing affordability divide even worse

image.altText: Rainbow flag

props.synopsis: A bill to ban gay conversion therapy will be introduced to NSW parliament today, with allowances made for parents and religious sermons.

title.children: NSW government says its plan to ban gay conversion therapy will 'save lives'. This is what it's planning to do

image.altText: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Premier Li Qiang dressed in suits stand inside a room.

props.synopsis: As China's annual rubberstamp parliament comes to a close, there are still looming questions about whether policymakers are doing enough to tackle the country's economic malaise, writes Kathleen Calderwood.

title.children: 'Not good': Beijing insists everything is fine. Here's what real people say about China's economic situation

image.altText: A glass of apple cider vinegar next to a glass bottle of the same liquid and half an apple.

props.synopsis: A new experimental study provides some evidence of a link between drinking apple cider vinegar and weight loss. Here's what we know.

title.children: Can a glass of apple cider vinegar a day keep the weight at bay? A new study suggests it could

image.altText: Admiral Jonathan Mead watches a Virginia-class submarine on the water.

props.synopsis: Defence Minister Richard Marles insists AUKUS partners are working "at pace" to help Australia acquire nuclear-powered submarines after the United States revealed it would halve next year's planned production of Virginia-class boats.

title.children: Former PM Malcolm Turnbull says Australians 'mugged by AUKUS reality' as US plans to halve submarine production

image.altText: Two soldiers, with their backs to a camera, operating a large machine outdoors with flames coming out of it

props.synopsis: A former Ukrainian MP urges Australia to provide more support to the country's war effort, after the efficacy of a deal struck with France last year to provide shells to the country's military comes under the microscope.

title.children: Australia promised to 'stand with Ukraine' — this is how the support ranks against the rest

image.altText: Andrew Giles scratches his head at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: The federal government has been forced to reveal it bungled issuing visas to 149 people released from immigration detention, meaning some who have breached strict monitoring conditions in the months since will get away with no consequences.

title.children: Immigration bungle results in former detainees who breached visa conditions escaping conviction

image.altText: An aerial view of hundreds of tents set up on brown sand across a stretch of land with a blue sky in the distance.

props.synopsis: The UK foreign secretary was questioned about a BBC report of Palestinian medics recounting alleged abuse and detention by Israeli troops following a hospital raid.

title.children: 'Very disturbing': David Cameron calls for answers to report of Israeli troops abusing Palestinian medics

image.altText: Special Counsel Robert Hur testifies. An asian man in a purple tie speaks into a mic

props.synopsis: The lawyer tasked with investigating US President Joe Biden's handling of classified documents defends his actions before congress.

title.children: Former special counsel Robert Hur defends comments on Joe Biden's age before congress

image.altText: A close-up of director Roman Polanski.

props.synopsis: A woman alleges director Roman Polanski raped her in his home when she was a minor in the 1970s.

title.children: Director Roman Polanski sued over more allegations of sexual assault of a minor

image.altText: The drug ice sitting on a bench top.

props.synopsis: Australia's alcohol consumption is in decline while the use of other drugs such as methamphetamines, cocaine and MDMA is growing, according to new wastewater analysis.

title.children: Australia's criminal intelligence agency tested our sewage for drugs. This is what they found

image.altText: Godzilla stalks a boat from behind while they are both in the sea

props.synopsis: On a budget of $18–23 million dollars, Godzilla Minus One has redefined what a low-budget action film can achieve — and it has the Oscar to prove it.

title.children: Can Godzilla Minus One's Oscar win disrupt the Marvel machine?

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses with her hair tied back sits in a chair in a tv studio.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Bronwyn Bishop apologises to Sophie Scamps after calling her "anti-Semitic" for asking for funding to be restored to the United Nations aid agency operating in Gaza.

title.children: Bronwyn Bishop makes on-air apology to Sophie Scamps for calling her 'anti-Semitic'

image.altText: A cat and a dog lying next to each other in the grass

props.synopsis: Researchers say a boom in pets during the pandemic could be linked to the increase in pet-related injuries to owners across Australia. Here are the key takeaways.

title.children: Pets increasingly causing more injuries in Australian households, study finds

image.altText: Three soldiers operate a missile launcher in light scrub

props.synopsis: Armed fighters who say they are Russian claim to have crossed the border from Ukraine to attack targets on the same day a wave of drone attacks damaged energy facilities including an oil refinery.

title.children: Anti-Kremlin fighters say they've taken a Russian village after cross-border attack from Ukraine
